english: Welsh Government and Local Authorities' Combined Budgets
welsh: Cyfun gyllideb Llywodraeth Cymru a'r Awdurdodau Lleol

english:
This tool has been developed by Dr Rhys ap Gwilym and Dr Edward Jones, economists at Bangor University’s Business School. It is intended to provide ‘rough and ready’ estimates of how changes to tax rates, thresholds, and more fundamental changes to the tax system in Wales might impact on revenues and, ultimately, the funding available for public services in Wales.
We intend to update and develop the calculator over time, so please do get in touch if you have suggestions for improvements. Inevitably, the analysis provided here is not detailed. So, again, please get in touch if you’re interested in more detailed analyses.
You can contact us at r.a.gwilym@bangor.ac.uk and e.t.jones@bangor.ac.uk.

Instructions:

The charts on the right, and the tables below them, show the total funds available to Welsh Government and Local Authorities in Wales under present plans and subject to any changes that you make in the tabs below. Click on the tabs below to make changes to tax rates, thresholds, and more fundamental changes to the tax system in three distinct areas:
welsh: Croeso i Ap Ffurflen Dreth Prifysgol Bangor. Yma gallwch weld dadansoddiad eich ffurflen dreth y flwyddyn flaenorol yn ogystal â chymhwyso hidlwyr treth penodol i weld dadansoddiad posibl ar gyfer ffurflen dreth y flwyddyn nesaf. MWY O WYBODAETH RHAGARWEINIOL YMA.

english:
Under the current devolution settlement, income tax payers in Wales pay a UK rate (set by the Westminster Government) and a Welsh rate (set by the Welsh Government) on non-savings, non-dividend (‘NSND’) income. The personal allowance (and personal allowance taper/limit) are set by the UK government, as are the thresholds for each income tax band. In Scotland, the devolved government has powers to alter the number of bands and adjust thresholds for NSND income tax. However, powers to set the personal allowance are reserved to Westminster, as is the taxation of savings and dividends income.

Instructions:
First choose whether you would like to make changes within the current settlement, according to the Scottish model, or where all powers over income tax (including personal allowance and savings/dividend income) are devolved. You will then be able to adjust the parameters that would be under Welsh Government control in your chosen scenario.
welsh:
Yn ôl y setliad datganoli presennol, mae trethdalwyr incwm yng Nghymru yn talu cyfradd y DU (a bennir gan Lywodraeth San Steffan) a chyfradd Cymreig (a osodir gan Lywodraeth Cymru) ar incwm di-gynilion a di-ddifidend (‘NSND’). Mae’r lwfans personol (a thapr/terfyn lwfans personol) yn cael eu gosod gan lywodraeth y DU, yn ogystal â’r trothwyon ar gyfer pob band treth incwm. Yn yr Alban, mae gan y llywodraeth ddatganoledig bwerau i newid nifer y bandiau ac addasu trothwyon ar gyfer treth incwm NSND. Fodd bynnag, mae pwerau i osod y lwfans personol yn cael eu hawlio gan San Steffan, yn ogystal â threthu incwm o gynilion a difidendau.

Cyfarwyddiadau:
Cychwynnwch wrth ddethol os hoffech wneud newidiadau o fewn y setliad presennol, yn unol â model yr Alban, neu lle mae’r holl bwerau dros dreth incwm (gan gynnwys lwfans personol ac incwm cynilion/difidend) wedi’u datganoli. Yna byddwch yn gallu addasu’r paramedrau a fyddai dan reolaeth Llywodraeth Cymru yn unol â’r detholiad hwnnw.

english: Income Tax Distribution per Salary Band
welsh: Dosbarthiad Treth Incwm yn ôl Bandau Cyflog

english:
In accordance with the Wales Act (2014), Welsh Government has full powers over Local Taxes in Wales.
Some of these powers are further devolved to Local Authorities, but Welsh Government has the legal right to cancel or alter these powers. Currently there are two Local Taxes, Council Tax and Non-Domestic Rates (NDR).
Legislation for a Visitor Levy is expected to be introduced imminently.

Instructions:
In this tab, you can keep or cancel the existing Local Taxes and complement or replace them with a Property Tax and/or Visitor Levy.
welsh:
Yn ôl Deddf Cymru (2014), Llywodraeth Cymru sydd yn holl gyfrifol am Trethi Lleol yng Nghymru.
Mae rhai o’r bwerau yma wedi eu datganoli i Awdurdodau Lleol, ond mae gan Lywodraeth Cymru y rym i ddileu neu addasu y pwerau hyn. Yn bresennol, dau Treth Lleol sydd yn bodoli, sef Treth y Cyngor ac Ardrethi Annomestig. Disgwylir i Dreth Twristiaeth cael ei ddeddfu yn fuan.

Cyfarwyddiadau:
Yn y tab hwn cewch cadw neu diddymu y Trethi Lleol presennol a’u ategu neu ddisodli gan Dreth Eiddo a/neu Treth Ymwelwyr.

english: Select system for local tax filters and calculations
welsh: Dewiswch system ar gyfer hidlwyr a chyfrifon treth leol

english: Other Taxes available with chosen system (all values in £millions):
welsh: Trethi eraill sydd ar gael gyda'r system ddewisol (pob gwerth yn £miliynau):

english:
At present, there are two other taxes within the Welsh Government’s control. These are the Land Transaction Tax and the Landfill Disposals Tax.

Instructions:
In this tab, you can vary the rates and thresholds of the Land Transaction Tax and the rates of the Landfill Disposals Tax.
welsh:
Ar hyn o bryd, mae dau dreth arall o fewn rheolaeth Lywodraeth Cymru, sef y Treth Trafodiadau Tir a’r Treth Gwarediadau Tirlenwi.

Cyfarwyddiadau:
Yn y tab hwn cewch addasu cyfraddau a throthwyon y Treth Trafodiadau Tir a chyfraddau y Treth Gwarediadau Tirlenwi.

english:
In this sub-tool, you can experiment with the introduction of a local property tax.
Separate rates can be set for the land and buildings components of properties - commonly known as a 'split rate' system. Setting a positive rate for land and a zero rate for buildings is equivalent to a classical land value tax (LVT), as outlined in our 'Technical assessment of the potential for a local land value tax in Wales'. In this tool, the tax rate on land is required to be no lower than the tax rate on buildings.
The tax rate on residential properties can be made progressive by including a tax-free allowance. The underlying assumption is that property taxes would be payable by the owner of the property, and so the tax-free allowance is not applicable to landlords of multiple properties.
welsh:
Yn yr is-offeryn hwn, gallwch arbrofi gyda chyflwyno treth eiddo lleol.
Gellir gosod cyfraddau ar wahân ar gyfer y cydrannau tir ac adeiladau eiddo - a elwir yn gyffredin yn system 'cyfradd hollt'. Mae gosod cyfradd bositif ar dir a chyfradd sero ar adeiladau yn gyfwerth â threth gwerth tir glasurol (LVT), fel y manylir yn ein 'Asesiad technegol o'r potensial ar gyfer treth gwerth tir lleol yng Nghymru'. Yn yr offeryn hwn, mae'n ofynnol i'r gyfradd dreth ar dir beidio â bod yn is na'r gyfradd dreth ar adeiladau.
Gellir gwneud y gyfradd dreth ar eiddo preswyl yn flaengar drwy gynnwys lwfans di-dreth. Y rhagdybiaeth sylfaenol yw y byddai trethi eiddo yn daladwy gan berchennog yr eiddo, ac felly nid yw'r lwfans di-dreth yn berthnasol i landlordiaid sy'n berchen ar nifer o eiddo.
